P. falciparum.name: Plasmodium falciparum
P. falciparum.characteristics: Small parasites, ring forms common, multiple rings in RBCs
P. falciparum.clinical_impact: Cerebral malaria, severe anemia, organ failure

P. vivax.name: Plasmodium vivax
P. vivax.characteristics: Larger parasites, pale cytoplasm, infected RBCs larger and distorted

P. ovale.name: Plasmodium ovale
P. ovale.characteristics: Similar to P. vivax, infected RBCs more oval/fimbriated
P. ovale.clinical_impact: Similar to P. vivax, rare relapse

P. malariae.name: Plasmodium malariae
P. malariae.characteristics: Smallest parasites, infected RBCs normal size

P. knowlesi.name: Plasmodium knowlesi
P. knowlesi.characteristics: Can look like P. malariae, rapid replication
P. knowlesi.clinical_impact: Rapid disease progression, can mimic P. falciparum

thick_blood_smear.definition: Concentration of blood on microscope slide without RBC lysis

interpretation.parasites_per_microliter: Parasitemia level - correlates with disease severity
interpretation.detection_sensitivity: 50-90% depending on parasitemia level and operator skill

positive_threshold.description: Lower threshold prioritizes sensitivity (catches more cases) at cost of specificity

model_output_interpretation.confidence: Probability score from 0 to 1 (not a clinical probability)
model_output_interpretation.sensitivity: Percentage of actual infected cases correctly identified by model
model_output_interpretation.specificity: Percentage of actual uninfected cases correctly identified by model
model_output_interpretation.note: Always require human expert verification before clinical decision-making
